alert.note: Alert for Lancaster; Mathews (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 09 at 10:21PM EST until January 10 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Maryland, including the following areas, Dorchester, Inland Worcester, Maryland Beaches, Somerset and Wicomico and Virginia, including the following areas, Accomack, Chesapeake, Gloucester, Hampton/Poquoson, Isle of Wight, Lancaster, Mathews, Middlesex, Newport News, Norfolk/Portsmouth, Northampton, Northumberland, Suffolk, Virginia Beach and York. * WHEN...Until 1 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Strong low pressure and a cold front will continue to bring rain to the area into the early morning hours. Additional rainfall will generally be less than one inch, with localized additional rainfall in excess of one inch over the Eastern Shore. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
